intro: Leptacanthus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and linear, often arranged alternately along the stem. Leptacanthus species are native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia. These plants are often found in dry, open habitats and are known for their ability to thrive in arid conditions.
